member.summary: Collection of all s supported by DataSync

summary.p: The STANDARD mode provides the latest recommended default values that should be safe to run in most scenarios
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The IN_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services from within the same AWS region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The CROSS_REGION mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for applications which call AWS services in a different region
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The MOBILE mode builds on the standard mode and includes optimization tailored for mobile applications
Note that the default values vended from this mode might change as best practices may evolve. As a result, it is encouraged to perform tests when upgrading the SDK
The AUTO mode is an experimental mode that builds on the standard mode. The SDK will attempt to discover the execution environment to determine the appropriate settings automatically.

Note that the auto detection is heuristics-based and does not guarantee 100% accuracy. STANDARD mode will be used if the execution environment cannot be determined. The auto detection might query EC2 Instance Metadata service, which might introduce latency. Therefore we recommend choosing an explicit defaults_mode instead if startup latency is critical to your application
The LEGACY mode provides default settings that vary per SDK and were used prior to establishment of defaults_mode

member.summary: Amazon DataSync endpoint provider. Resolves endpoint for given set of DataSyncEndpointParameters. Can throw AmazonClientException if endpoint resolution is unsuccessful.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Internal.AmazonDataSyncEndpointResolver
member.summary: Amazon DataSync endpoint resolver. Custom PipelineHandler responsible for resolving endpoint and setting authentication parameters for DataSync service requests. Collects values for DataSyncEndpointParameters and then tries to resolve endpoint by calling ResolveEndpoint method on GlobalEndpoints.Provider if present, otherwise uses DataSyncEndpointProvider. Responsible for setting authentication and http headers provided by resolved endpoint.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AddStorageSystemRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the AddStorageSystem operation. Creates an Amazon Web Services resource for an on-premises storage system that you want DataSync Discovery to collect information about.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AddStorageSystemRequest.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DataSync agent that connects to and reads from your on-premises storage system's management interface. You can only specify one ARN.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AddStorageSystemRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
Specifies a client token to make sure requests with this API operation are idempotent. If you don't specify a client token, DataSync generates one for you automatically.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AddStorageSystemRequest.CloudWatchLogGroupArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CloudWatchLogGroupArn.
Specifies the ARN of the Amazon CloudWatch log group for monitoring and logging discovery job events.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AddStorageSystemRequest.Credentials
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Credentials.
Specifies the user name and password for accessing your on-premises storage system's management interface.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AddStorageSystemRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Specifies a familiar name for your on-premises storage system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AddStorageSystemRequest.ServerConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerConfiguration.
Specifies the server name and network port required to connect with the management interface of your on-premises storage system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AddStorageSystemRequest.SystemType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SystemType.
Specifies the type of on-premises storage system that you want DataSync Discovery to collect information about.
DataSync Discovery currently supports NetApp Fabric-Attached Storage (FAS) and All Flash FAS (AFF) systems running ONTAP 9.7 or later.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AddStorageSystemRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies labels that help you categorize, filter, and search for your Amazon Web Services resources. We recommend creating at least a name tag for your on-premises storage system.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AddStorageSystemResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the AddStorageSystem operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AddStorageSystemResponse.StorageSystemArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageSystemArn.
The ARN of the on-premises storage system that you can use with DataSync Discovery.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AgentListEntry
member.summary: Represents a single entry in a list (or array) of DataSync agents when you call the ListAgents operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AgentListEntry.AgentArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a DataSync agent.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AgentListEntry.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of an agent.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AgentListEntry.Platform
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Platform.
The platform-related details about the agent, such as the version number.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AgentListEntry.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of an agent.
If the status is ONLINE, the agent is configured properly and ready to use.
If the status is OFFLINE, the agent has been out of contact with DataSync for five minutes or longer. This can happen for a few reasons. For more information, see What do I do if my agent is offline?

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AzureBlobSasConfiguration
member.summary:
The shared access signature (SAS) configuration that allows DataSync to access your Microsoft Azure Blob Storage.
For more information, see SAS tokens for accessing your Azure Blob Storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.AzureBlobSasConfiguration.Token
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Token.
Specifies a SAS token that provides permissions to access your Azure Blob Storage.
The token is part of the SAS URI string that comes after the storage resource URI and a question mark. A token looks something like this:
sp=r&st=2023-12-20T14:54:52Z&se=2023-12-20T22:54:52Z&spr=https&sv=2021-06-08&sr=c&sig=aBBKDWQvyuVcTPH9EBp%2FXTI9E%2F%2Fmq171%2BZU178wcwqU%3D

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CancelTaskExecutionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CancelTaskExecution operation. Stops an DataSync task execution that's in progress. The transfer of some files are abruptly interrupted. File contents that're transferred to the destination might be incomplete or inconsistent with the source files.
However, if you start a new task execution using the same task and allow it to finish, file content on the destination will be complete and consistent. This applies to other unexpected failures that interrupt a task execution. In all of these cases, DataSync successfully completes the transfer when you start the next task execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CancelTaskExecutionRequest.TaskExecutionArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskExecutionArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task execution to stop.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CancelTaskExecutionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CancelTaskExecution operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Capacity
member.summary: The storage capacity of an on-premises storage system resource (for example, a volume).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Capacity.ClusterCloudStorageUsed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClusterCloudStorageUsed.
The amount of space in the cluster that's in cloud storage (for example, if you're using data tiering).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Capacity.LogicalUsed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LogicalUsed.
The amount of space that's being used in a storage system resource without accounting for compression or deduplication.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Capacity.Provisioned
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Provisioned.
The total amount of space available in a storage system resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Capacity.Used
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Used.
The amount of space that's being used in a storage system resource.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateAgentRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateAgent operation. Activates an DataSync agent that you deploy in your storage environment. The activation process associates the agent with your Amazon Web Services account.
If you haven't deployed an agent yet, see Do I need a DataSync agent?

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateAgentRequest.ActivationKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActivationKey.
Specifies your DataSync agent's activation key. If you don't have an activation key, see Activating your agent.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateAgentRequest.AgentName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentName.
Specifies a name for your agent. We recommend specifying a name that you can remember.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateAgentRequest.SecurityGroupArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityGroupArns.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the security group that allows traffic between your agent and VPC service endpoint. You can only specify one ARN.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateAgentRequest.SubnetArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubnetArns.
Specifies the ARN of the subnet where your VPC service endpoint is located. You can only specify one ARN.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateAgentRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies labels that help you categorize, filter, and search for your Amazon Web Services resources. We recommend creating at least one tag for your agent.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateAgentRequest.VpcEndpointId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VpcEndpointId.
Specifies the ID of the VPC service endpoint that you're using. For example, a VPC endpoint ID looks like vpce-01234d5aff67890e1.
The VPC service endpoint you use must include the DataSync service name (for example, com.amazonaws.us-east-2.datasync).

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateAgentResponse
member.summary: CreateAgentResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateAgentResponse.AgentArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArn.
The ARN of the agent that you just activated. Use the ListAgents operation to return a list of agents in your Amazon Web Services account and Amazon Web Services Region.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationAzureBlobRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLocationAzureBlob operation. Creates a transfer location for a Microsoft Azure Blob Storage container. DataSync can use this location as a transfer source or destination.
Before you begin, make sure you know how DataSync accesses Azure Blob Storage and works with access tiers and blob types. You also need a DataSync agent that can connect to your container.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationAzureBlobRequest.AccessTier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessTier.
Specifies the access tier that you want your objects or files transferred into. This only applies when using the location as a transfer destination. For more information, see Access tiers.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationAzureBlobRequest.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DataSync agent that can connect with your Azure Blob Storage container.
You can specify more than one agent. For more information, see Using multiple agents for your transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationAzureBlobRequest.AuthenticationType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthenticationType.
Specifies the authentication method DataSync uses to access your Azure Blob Storage. DataSync can access blob storage using a shared access signature (SAS).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationAzureBlobRequest.BlobType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlobType.
Specifies the type of blob that you want your objects or files to be when transferring them into Azure Blob Storage. Currently, DataSync only supports moving data into Azure Blob Storage as block blobs. For more information on blob types, see the Azure Blob Storage documentation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationAzureBlobRequest.ContainerUrl
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContainerUrl.
Specifies the URL of the Azure Blob Storage container involved in your transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationAzureBlobRequest.SasConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SasConfiguration.
Specifies the SAS configuration that allows DataSync to access your Azure Blob Storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationAzureBlobRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies path segments if you want to limit your transfer to a virtual directory in your container (for example, /my/images).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationAzureBlobRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies labels that help you categorize, filter, and search for your Amazon Web Services resources. We recommend creating at least a name tag for your transfer location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationAzureBlobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateLocationAzureBlob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationAzureBlobResponse.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The ARN of the Azure Blob Storage transfer location that you created.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationEfsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLocationEfs operation. Creates a transfer location for an Amazon EFS file system. DataSync can use this location as a source or destination for transferring data.
Before you begin, make sure that you understand how DataSync accesses Amazon EFS file systems.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationEfsRequest.AccessPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessPointArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access point that DataSync uses to mount your Amazon EFS file system.
For more information, see Accessing restricted file systems.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationEfsRequest.Ec2Config
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Ec2Config.
Specifies the subnet and security groups DataSync uses to connect to one of your Amazon EFS file system's mount targets.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationEfsRequest.EfsFilesystemArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EfsFilesystemArn.
Specifies the ARN for your Amazon EFS file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationEfsRequest.FileSystemAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileSystemAccessRoleArn.
Specifies an Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows DataSync to access your Amazon EFS file system.
For information on creating this role, see Creating a DataSync IAM role for file system access.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationEfsRequest.InTransitEncryption
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InTransitEncryption.
Specifies whether you want DataSync to use Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.2 encryption when it transfers data to or from your Amazon EFS file system.
If you specify an access point using AccessPointArn or an IAM role using FileSystemAccessRoleArn, you must set this parameter to TLS1_2.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationEfsRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies a mount path for your Amazon EFS file system. This is where DataSync reads or writes data on your file system (depending on if this is a source or destination location).
By default, DataSync uses the root directory (or access point if you provide one by using AccessPointArn). You can also include subdirectories using forward slashes (for example, /path/to/folder).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationEfsRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies the key-value pair that represents a tag that you want to add to the resource. The value can be an empty string. This value helps you manage, filter, and search for your resources. We recommend that you create a name tag for your location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationEfsResponse
member.summary: CreateLocationEfs

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationEfsResponse.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EFS file system location that you create.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxLustreRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLocationFsxLustre operation. Creates a transfer location for an Amazon FSx for Lustre file system. DataSync can use this location as a source or destination for transferring data.
Before you begin, make sure that you understand how DataSync accesses FSx for Lustre file systems.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxLustreRequest.FsxFilesystemArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FsxFilesystemArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the FSx for Lustre file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxLustreRequest.SecurityGroupArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityGroupArns.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of up to five security groups that provide access to your FSx for Lustre file system.
The security groups must be able to access the file system's ports. The file system must also allow access from the security groups. For information about file system access, see the Amazon FSx for Lustre User Guide .

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxLustreRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies a mount path for your FSx for Lustre file system. The path can include subdirectories.
When the location is used as a source, DataSync reads data from the mount path. When the location is used as a destination, DataSync writes data to the mount path. If you don't include this parameter, DataSync uses the file system's root directory (/).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxLustreRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies labels that help you categorize, filter, and search for your Amazon Web Services resources. We recommend creating at least a name tag for your location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxLustreResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateLocationFsxLustre operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxLustreResponse.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the FSx for Lustre file system location that you created.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOntapRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLocationFsxOntap operation. Creates a transfer location for an Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP file system. DataSync can use this location as a source or destination for transferring data.
Before you begin, make sure that you understand how DataSync accesses FSx for ONTAP file systems.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOntapRequest.Protocol
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Protocol.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOntapRequest.SecurityGroupArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityGroupArns.
Specifies the Amazon EC2 security groups that provide access to your file system's preferred subnet.
The security groups must allow outbound traffic on the following ports (depending on the protocol you use):
Network File System (NFS): TCP ports 111, 635, and 2049
Server Message Block (SMB): TCP port 445
Your file system's security groups must also allow inbound traffic on the same ports.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOntapRequest.StorageVirtualMachineArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageVirtualMachineArn.
Specifies the ARN of the storage virtual machine (SVM) in your file system where you want to copy data to or from.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOntapRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies a path to the file share in the SVM where you want to transfer data to or from.
You can specify a junction path (also known as a mount point), qtree path (for NFS file shares), or share name (for SMB file shares). For example, your mount path might be /vol1, /vol1/tree1, or /share1.
Don't specify a junction path in the SVM's root volume. For more information, see Managing FSx for ONTAP storage virtual machines in the Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOntapRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies labels that help you categorize, filter, and search for your Amazon Web Services resources. We recommend creating at least a name tag for your location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOntapResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateLocationFsxOntap operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOntapResponse.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the ARN of the FSx for ONTAP file system location that you create.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOpenZfsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLocationFsxOpenZfs operation. Creates a transfer location for an Amazon FSx for OpenZFS file system. DataSync can use this location as a source or destination for transferring data.
Before you begin, make sure that you understand how DataSync accesses FSx for OpenZFS file systems.
Request parameters related to SMB aren't supported with the CreateLocationFsxOpenZfs operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOpenZfsRequest.FsxFilesystemArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FsxFilesystemArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the FSx for OpenZFS file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOpenZfsRequest.Protocol
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Protocol.
The type of protocol that DataSync uses to access your file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOpenZfsRequest.SecurityGroupArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityGroupArns.
The ARNs of the security groups that are used to configure the FSx for OpenZFS file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOpenZfsRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
A subdirectory in the location's path that must begin with /fsx. DataSync uses this subdirectory to read or write data (depending on whether the file system is a source or destination location).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOpenZfsRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The key-value pair that represents a tag that you want to add to the resource. The value can be an empty string. This value helps you manage, filter, and search for your resources. We recommend that you create a name tag for your location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOpenZfsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateLocationFsxOpenZfs operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxOpenZfsResponse.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The ARN of the FSx for OpenZFS file system location that you created.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxWindowsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLocationFsxWindows operation. Creates a transfer location for an Amazon FSx for Windows File Server file system. DataSync can use this location as a source or destination for transferring data.
Before you begin, make sure that you understand how DataSync accesses FSx for Windows File Server file systems.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxWindowsRequest.Domain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Domain.
Specifies the name of the Windows domain that the FSx for Windows File Server file system belongs to.
If you have multiple Active Directory domains in your environment, configuring this parameter makes sure that DataSync connects to the right file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxWindowsRequest.FsxFilesystemArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FsxFilesystemArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the FSx for Windows File Server file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxWindowsRequest.Password
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Password.
Specifies the password of the user with the permissions to mount and access the files, folders, and file metadata in your FSx for Windows File Server file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxWindowsRequest.SecurityGroupArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityGroupArns.
Specifies the ARNs of the Amazon EC2 security groups that provide access to your file system's preferred subnet.
The security groups that you specify must be able to communicate with your file system's security groups. For information about configuring security groups for file system access, see the Amazon FSx for Windows File Server User Guide .
If you choose a security group that doesn't allow connections from within itself, do one of the following:
Configure the security group to allow it to communicate within itself.
Choose a different security group that can communicate with the mount target's security group.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxWindowsRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies a mount path for your file system using forward slashes. This is where DataSync reads or writes data (depending on if this is a source or destination location).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxWindowsRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies labels that help you categorize, filter, and search for your Amazon Web Services resources. We recommend creating at least a name tag for your location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxWindowsRequest.User
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property User.
Specifies the user with the permissions to mount and access the files, folders, and file metadata in your FSx for Windows File Server file system.
For information about choosing a user with the right level of access for your transfer, see required permissions for FSx for Windows File Server locations.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxWindowsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateLocationFsxWindows operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationFsxWindowsResponse.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The ARN of the FSx for Windows File Server file system location you created.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLocationHdfs operation. Creates a transfer location for a Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS). DataSync can use this location as a source or destination for transferring data.
Before you begin, make sure that you understand how DataSync accesses HDFS clusters.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the DataSync agents that can connect to your HDFS cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.AuthenticationType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthenticationType.
The type of authentication used to determine the identity of the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.BlockSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockSize.
The size of data blocks to write into the HDFS cluster. The block size must be a multiple of 512 bytes. The default block size is 128 mebibytes (MiB).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.KerberosKeytab
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KerberosKeytab.
The Kerberos key table (keytab) that contains mappings between the defined Kerberos principal and the encrypted keys. You can load the keytab from a file by providing the file's address. If you're using the CLI, it performs base64 encoding for you. Otherwise, provide the base64-encoded text.
If KERBEROS is specified for AuthenticationType, this parameter is required.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.KerberosKrb5Conf
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KerberosKrb5Conf.
The krb5.conf file that contains the Kerberos configuration information. You can load the krb5.conf file by providing the file's address. If you're using the CLI, it performs the base64 encoding for you. Otherwise, provide the base64-encoded text.
If KERBEROS is specified for AuthenticationType, this parameter is required.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.KerberosPrincipal
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KerberosPrincipal.
The Kerberos principal with access to the files and folders on the HDFS cluster.
If KERBEROS is specified for AuthenticationType, this parameter is required.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.KmsKeyProviderUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyProviderUri.
The URI of the HDFS cluster's Key Management Server (KMS).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.NameNodes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NameNodes.
The NameNode that manages the HDFS namespace. The NameNode performs operations such as opening, closing, and renaming files and directories. The NameNode contains the information to map blocks of data to the DataNodes. You can use only one NameNode.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.QopConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QopConfiguration.
The Quality of Protection (QOP) configuration specifies the Remote Procedure Call (RPC) and data transfer protection settings configured on the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) cluster. If QopConfiguration isn't specified, RpcProtection and DataTransferProtection default to PRIVACY. If you set RpcProtection or DataTransferProtection, the other parameter assumes the same value.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.ReplicationFactor
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationFactor.
The number of DataNodes to replicate the data to when writing to the HDFS cluster. By default, data is replicated to three DataNodes.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.SimpleUser
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SimpleUser.
The user name used to identify the client on the host operating system.
If SIMPLE is specified for AuthenticationType, this parameter is required.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
A subdirectory in the HDFS cluster. This subdirectory is used to read data from or write data to the HDFS cluster. If the subdirectory isn't specified, it will default to /.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
The key-value pair that represents the tag that you want to add to the location. The value can be an empty string. We recommend using tags to name your resources.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateLocationHdfs operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationHdfsResponse.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The ARN of the source HDFS cluster location that you create.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationNfsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLocationNfs operation. Creates a transfer location for a Network File System (NFS) file server. DataSync can use this location as a source or destination for transferring data.
Before you begin, make sure that you understand how DataSync accesses NFS file servers.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationNfsRequest.MountOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MountOptions.
Specifies the options that DataSync can use to mount your NFS file server.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationNfsRequest.OnPremConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OnPremConfig.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DataSync agent that can connect to your NFS file server.
You can specify more than one agent. For more information, see Using multiple DataSync agents.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationNfsRequest.ServerHostname
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerHostname.
Specifies the Domain Name System (DNS) name or IP version 4 address of the NFS file server that your DataSync agent connects to.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationNfsRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies the export path in your NFS file server that you want DataSync to mount.
This path (or a subdirectory of the path) is where DataSync transfers data to or from. For information on configuring an export for DataSync, see Accessing NFS file servers.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationNfsRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies labels that help you categorize, filter, and search for your Amazon Web Services resources. We recommend creating at least a name tag for your location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationNfsResponse
member.summary: CreateLocationNfsResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationNfsResponse.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The ARN of the transfer location that you created for your NFS file server.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLocationObjectStorage operation. Creates a transfer location for an object storage system. DataSync can use this location as a source or destination for transferring data.
Before you begin, make sure that you understand the prerequisites for DataSync to work with object storage systems.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageRequest.AccessKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessKey.
Specifies the access key (for example, a user name) if credentials are required to authenticate with the object storage server.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageRequest.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the DataSync agents that can connect with your object storage system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageRequest.BucketName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketName.
Specifies the name of the object storage bucket involved in the transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageRequest.SecretKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretKey.
Specifies the secret key (for example, a password) if credentials are required to authenticate with the object storage server.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageRequest.ServerCertificate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerCertificate.
Specifies a certificate chain for DataSync to authenticate with your object storage system if the system uses a private or self-signed certificate authority (CA). You must specify a single .pem file with a full certificate chain (for example, file:///home/user/.ssh/object_storage_certificates.pem).
The certificate chain might include:
The object storage system's certificate
All intermediate certificates (if there are any)
The root certificate of the signing CA
You can concatenate your certificates into a .pem file (which can be up to 32768 bytes before base64 encoding). The following example cat command creates an object_storage_certificates.pem file that includes three certificates:
cat object_server_certificate.pem intermediate_certificate.pem ca_root_certificate.pem > object_storage_certificates.pem
To use this parameter, configure ServerProtocol to HTTPS.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageRequest.ServerHostname
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerHostname.
Specifies the domain name or IP address of the object storage server. A DataSync agent uses this hostname to mount the object storage server in a network.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageRequest.ServerPort
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerPort.
Specifies the port that your object storage server accepts inbound network traffic on (for example, port 443).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageRequest.ServerProtocol
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerProtocol.
Specifies the protocol that your object storage server uses to communicate.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies the object prefix for your object storage server. If this is a source location, DataSync only copies objects with this prefix. If this is a destination location, DataSync writes all objects with this prefix.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies the key-value pair that represents a tag that you want to add to the resource. Tags can help you manage, filter, and search for your resources. We recommend creating a name tag for your location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageResponse
member.summary: CreateLocationObjectStorageResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationObjectStorageResponse.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the ARN of the object storage system location that you create.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationS3Request
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLocationS3 operation. Creates a transfer location for an Amazon S3 bucket. DataSync can use this location as a source or destination for transferring data.
Before you begin, make sure that you read the following topics:
Storage class considerations with Amazon S3 locations
Evaluating S3 request costs when using DataSync
For more information, see Configuring transfers with Amazon S3.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationS3Request.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
(Amazon S3 on Outposts only) Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DataSync agent on your Outpost.
For more information, see Deploy your DataSync agent on Outposts.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationS3Request.S3BucketArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3BucketArn.
Specifies the ARN of the S3 bucket that you want to use as a location. (When creating your DataSync task later, you specify whether this location is a transfer source or destination.)
If your S3 bucket is located on an Outposts resource, you must specify an Amazon S3 access point. For more information, see Managing data access with Amazon S3 access points in the Amazon S3 User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationS3Request.S3Config
member.summary: Gets and sets the property S3Config.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationS3Request.S3StorageClass
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3StorageClass.
Specifies the storage class that you want your objects to use when Amazon S3 is a transfer destination.
For buckets in Amazon Web Services Regions, the storage class defaults to STANDARD. For buckets on Outposts, the storage class defaults to OUTPOSTS.
For more information, see Storage class considerations with Amazon S3 transfers.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationS3Request.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies a prefix in the S3 bucket that DataSync reads from or writes to (depending on whether the bucket is a source or destination location).
DataSync can't transfer objects with a prefix that begins with a slash (/) or includes //, /./, or /../ patterns. For example:
/photos
photos//2006/January
photos/./2006/February
photos/../2006/March

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationS3Request.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies labels that help you categorize, filter, and search for your Amazon Web Services resources. We recommend creating at least a name tag for your transfer location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationS3Response
member.summary: CreateLocationS3Response

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationS3Response.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The ARN of the S3 location that you created.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationSmbRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateLocationSmb operation. Creates a transfer location for a Server Message Block (SMB) file server. DataSync can use this location as a source or destination for transferring data.
Before you begin, make sure that you understand how DataSync accesses SMB file servers.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationSmbRequest.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
Specifies the DataSync agent (or agents) that can connect to your SMB file server. You specify an agent by using its Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationSmbRequest.Domain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Domain.
Specifies the name of the Active Directory domain that your SMB file server belongs to.
If you have multiple Active Directory domains in your environment, configuring this parameter makes sure that DataSync connects to the right file server.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationSmbRequest.MountOptions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MountOptions.
Specifies the version of the SMB protocol that DataSync uses to access your SMB file server.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationSmbRequest.Password
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Password.
Specifies the password of the user who can mount your SMB file server and has permission to access the files and folders involved in your transfer.
For more information, see required permissions for SMB locations.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationSmbRequest.ServerHostname
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerHostname.
Specifies the Domain Name Service (DNS) name or IP address of the SMB file server that your DataSync agent will mount.
You can't specify an IP version 6 (IPv6) address.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationSmbRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies the name of the share exported by your SMB file server where DataSync will read or write data. You can include a subdirectory in the share path (for example, /path/to/subdirectory). Make sure that other SMB clients in your network can also mount this path.
To copy all data in the subdirectory, DataSync must be able to mount the SMB share and access all of its data. For more information, see required permissions for SMB locations.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationSmbRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies labels that help you categorize, filter, and search for your Amazon Web Services resources. We recommend creating at least a name tag for your location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationSmbRequest.User
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property User.
Specifies the user that can mount and access the files, folders, and file metadata in your SMB file server.
For information about choosing a user with the right level of access for your transfer, see required permissions for SMB locations.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationSmbResponse
member.summary: CreateLocationSmbResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateLocationSmbResponse.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The ARN of the SMB location that you created.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the CreateTask operation. Configures a task, which defines where and how DataSync transfers your data.
A task includes a source location, destination location, and transfer options (such as bandwidth limits, scheduling, and more).
If you're planning to transfer data to or from an Amazon S3 location, review how DataSync can affect your S3 request charges and the DataSync pricing page before you begin.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest.CloudWatchLogGroupArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CloudWatchLogGroupArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon CloudWatch log group for monitoring your task.
For Enhanced mode tasks, you don't need to specify anything. DataSync automatically sends logs to a CloudWatch log group named /aws/datasync.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest.DestinationLocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DestinationLocationArn.
Specifies the ARN of your transfer's destination location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest.Excludes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Excludes.
Specifies exclude filters that define the files, objects, and folders in your source location that you don't want DataSync to transfer. For more information and examples, see Specifying what DataSync transfers by using filters.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest.Includes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Includes.
Specifies include filters that define the files, objects, and folders in your source location that you want DataSync to transfer. For more information and examples, see Specifying what DataSync transfers by using filters.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest.ManifestConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManifestConfig.
Configures a manifest, which is a list of files or objects that you want DataSync to transfer. For more information and configuration examples, see Specifying what DataSync transfers by using a manifest.
When using this parameter, your caller identity (the role that you're using DataSync with) must have the iam:PassRole permission. The AWSDataSyncFullAccess policy includes this permission.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Specifies the name of your task.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest.Options
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Options.
Specifies your task's settings, such as preserving file metadata, verifying data integrity, among other options.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest.Schedule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Schedule.
Specifies a schedule for when you want your task to run. For more information, see Scheduling your task.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest.SourceLocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceLocationArn.
Specifies the ARN of your transfer's source location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies the tags that you want to apply to your task.
Tags are key-value pairs that help you manage, filter, and search for your DataSync resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest.TaskMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskMode.
Specifies one of the following task modes for your data transfer:
ENHANCED - Transfer virtually unlimited numbers of objects with higher performance than Basic mode. Enhanced mode tasks optimize the data transfer process by listing, preparing, transferring, and verifying data in parallel. Enhanced mode is currently available for transfers between Amazon S3 locations.
To create an Enhanced mode task, the IAM role that you use to call the CreateTask operation must have the iam:CreateServiceLinkedRole permission.
BASIC (default) - Transfer files or objects between Amazon Web Services storage and all other supported DataSync locations. Basic mode tasks are subject to quotas on the number of files, objects, and directories in a dataset. Basic mode sequentially prepares, transfers, and verifies data, making it slower than Enhanced mode for most workloads.
For more information, see Understanding task mode differences.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskRequest.TaskReportConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskReportConfig.
Specifies how you want to configure a task report, which provides detailed information about your DataSync transfer. For more information, see Monitoring your DataSync transfers with task reports.
When using this parameter, your caller identity (the role that you're using DataSync with) must have the iam:PassRole permission. The AWSDataSyncFullAccess policy includes this permission.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskResponse
member.summary: CreateTaskResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.CreateTaskResponse.TaskArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Credentials
member.summary:
The credentials that provide DataSync Discovery read access to your on-premises storage system's management interface.
DataSync Discovery stores these credentials in Secrets Manager. For more information, see Accessing your on-premises storage system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Credentials.Password
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Password.
Specifies the password for your storage system's management interface.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Credentials.Username
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Username.
Specifies the user name for your storage system's management interface.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DeleteAgentRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DeleteAgent operation. Removes an DataSync agent resource from your Amazon Web Services account.
Keep in mind that this operation (which can't be undone) doesn't remove the agent's virtual machine (VM) or Amazon EC2 instance from your storage environment. For next steps, you can delete the VM or instance from your storage environment or reuse it to activate a new agent.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DeleteAgentRequest.AgentArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the agent to delete. Use the ListAgents operation to return a list of agents for your account and Amazon Web Services Region.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DeleteAgentResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteAgent operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DeleteLocationRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteLocation operation. Deletes a transfer location resource from DataSync.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DeleteLocationRequest.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the location to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DeleteLocationResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteLocation operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DeleteTaskRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DeleteTask operation. Deletes a transfer task resource from DataSync.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DeleteTaskRequest.TaskArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task that you want to delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DeleteTaskResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DeleteTask operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeAgentRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeAgent operation. Returns information about an DataSync agent, such as its name, service endpoint type, and status.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeAgentRequest.AgentArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DataSync agent that you want information about.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeAgentResponse
member.summary: DescribeAgentResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeAgentResponse.AgentArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArn.
The ARN of the agent.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeAgentResponse.CreationTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreationTime.
The time that the agent was activated.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeAgentResponse.EndpointType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EndpointType.
The type of service endpoint that your agent is connected to.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeAgentResponse.LastConnectionTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastConnectionTime.
The last time that the agent was communicating with the DataSync service.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeAgentResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the agent.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeAgentResponse.Platform
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Platform.
The platform-related details about the agent, such as the version number.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeAgentResponse.PrivateLinkConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PrivateLinkConfig.
The network configuration that the agent uses when connecting to a VPC service endpoint.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeAgentResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the agent.
If the status is ONLINE, the agent is configured properly and ready to use.
If the status is OFFLINE, the agent has been out of contact with DataSync for five minutes or longer. This can happen for a few reasons. For more information, see What do I do if my agent is offline?

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeDiscoveryJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeDiscoveryJob operation. Returns information about a DataSync discovery job.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeDiscoveryJobRequest.DiscoveryJobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DiscoveryJobArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the discovery job that you want information about.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeDiscoveryJobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeDiscoveryJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeDiscoveryJobResponse.CollectionDurationMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CollectionDurationMinutes.
The number of minutes that the discovery job runs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeDiscoveryJobResponse.DiscoveryJobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DiscoveryJobArn.
The ARN of the discovery job.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeDiscoveryJobResponse.JobEndTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobEndTime.
The time when the discovery job ended.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeDiscoveryJobResponse.JobStartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStartTime.
The time when the discovery job started.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeDiscoveryJobResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Indicates the status of a discovery job. For more information, see Discovery job statuses.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeDiscoveryJobResponse.StorageSystemArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageSystemArn.
The ARN of the on-premises storage system you're running the discovery job on.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeLocationAzureBlobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeLocationAzureBlob operation. Provides details about how an DataSync transfer location for Microsoft Azure Blob Storage is configured.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeLocationAzureBlobRequest.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of your Azure Blob Storage transfer location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeLocationAzureBlobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeLocationAzureBlob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeLocationAzureBlobResponse.AccessTier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessTier.
The access tier that you want your objects or files transferred into. This only applies when using the location as a transfer destination. For more information, see Access tiers.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeLocationAzureBlobResponse.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
The ARNs of the DataSync agents that can connect with your Azure Blob Storage container.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeLocationAzureBlobResponse.AuthenticationType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthenticationType.
The authentication method DataSync uses to access your Azure Blob Storage. DataSync can access blob storage using a shared access signature (SAS).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeLocationAzureBlobResponse.BlobType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlobType.
The type of blob that you want your objects or files to be when transferring them into Azure Blob Storage. Currently, DataSync only supports moving data into Azure Blob Storage as block blobs. For more information on blob types, see the Azure Blob Storage documentation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeLocationAzureBlobResponse.CreationTime
member.summary:

The time that your Azure Blob Storage transfer location was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeLocationAzureBlobResponse.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The ARN of your Azure Blob Storage transfer location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeLocationAzureBlobResponse.LocationUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationUri.
The URL of the Azure Blob Storage container involved in your transfer.

The ARN of the secret that stores your on-premises storage system's credentials. DataSync Discovery stores these credentials in Secrets Manager.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeStorageSystemResponse.ServerConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerConfiguration.
The server name and network port required to connect with your on-premises storage system's management interface.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeStorageSystemResponse.StorageSystemArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageSystemArn.
The ARN of the on-premises storage system that the discovery job looked at.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeStorageSystemResponse.SystemType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SystemType.
The type of on-premises storage system.
DataSync Discovery currently only supports NetApp Fabric-Attached Storage (FAS) and All Flash FAS (AFF) systems running ONTAP 9.7 or later.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the DescribeTaskExecution operation. Provides information about an execution of your DataSync task. You can use this operation to help monitor the progress of an ongoing data transfer or check the results of the transfer.
Some DescribeTaskExecution response elements are only relevant to a specific task mode. For information, see Understanding task mode differences and Understanding data transfer performance counters.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionRequest.TaskExecutionArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskExecutionArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task execution that you want information about.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse
member.summary: DescribeTaskExecutionResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.BytesCompressed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BytesCompressed.
The number of physical bytes that DataSync transfers over the network after compression (if compression is possible). This number is typically less than BytesTransferred unless the data isn't compressible.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.BytesTransferred
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BytesTransferred.
The number of bytes that DataSync sends to the network before compression (if compression is possible). For the number of bytes transferred over the network, see BytesCompressed.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.BytesWritten
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BytesWritten.
The number of logical bytes that DataSync actually writes to the destination location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.EstimatedBytesToTransfer
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EstimatedBytesToTransfer.
The number of logical bytes that DataSync expects to write to the destination location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.EstimatedFilesToDelete
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EstimatedFilesToDelete.
The number of files, objects, and directories that DataSync expects to delete in your destination location. If you don't configure your task to delete data in the destination that isn't in the source, the value is always 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.EstimatedFilesToTransfer
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EstimatedFilesToTransfer.
The number of files, objects, and directories that DataSync expects to transfer over the network. This value is calculated while DataSync prepares the transfer.
How this gets calculated depends primarily on your task’s transfer mode configuration:
If TranserMode is set to CHANGED - The calculation is based on comparing the content of the source and destination locations and determining the difference that needs to be transferred. The difference can include:
Anything that's added or modified at the source location.
Anything that's in both locations and modified at the destination after an initial transfer (unless OverwriteMode is set to NEVER).
(Basic task mode only) The number of items that DataSync expects to delete (if PreserveDeletedFiles is set to REMOVE).
If TranserMode is set to ALL - The calculation is based only on the items that DataSync finds at the source location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.Excludes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Excludes.
A list of filter rules that exclude specific data during your transfer. For more information and examples, see Filtering data transferred by DataSync.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.FilesDeleted
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilesDeleted.
The number of files, objects, and directories that DataSync actually deletes in your destination location. If you don't configure your task to delete data in the destination that isn't in the source, the value is always 0.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.FilesFailed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilesFailed.
The number of objects that DataSync fails to prepare, transfer, verify, and delete during your task execution.
Applies only to Enhanced mode tasks.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.FilesListed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilesListed.
The number of objects that DataSync finds at your locations.
Applies only to Enhanced mode tasks.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.FilesPrepared
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilesPrepared.
The number of objects that DataSync will attempt to transfer after comparing your source and destination locations.
Applies only to Enhanced mode tasks.
This counter isn't applicable if you configure your task to transfer all data. In that scenario, DataSync copies everything from the source to the destination without comparing differences between the locations.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.FilesSkipped
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilesSkipped.
The number of files, objects, and directories that DataSync skips during your transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.FilesTransferred
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilesTransferred.
The number of files, objects, and directories that DataSync actually transfers over the network. This value is updated periodically during your task execution when something is read from the source and sent over the network.
If DataSync fails to transfer something, this value can be less than EstimatedFilesToTransfer. In some cases, this value can also be greater than EstimatedFilesToTransfer. This element is implementation-specific for some location types, so don't use it as an exact indication of what's transferring or to monitor your task execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.FilesVerified
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilesVerified.
The number of files, objects, and directories that DataSync verifies during your transfer.
When you configure your task to verify only the data that's transferred, DataSync doesn't verify directories in some situations or files that fail to transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.Includes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Includes.
A list of filter rules that include specific data during your transfer. For more information and examples, see Filtering data transferred by DataSync.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.ManifestConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManifestConfig.
The configuration of the manifest that lists the files or objects to transfer. For more information, see Specifying what DataSync transfers by using a manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.Options
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Options.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.ReportResult
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportResult.
Indicates whether DataSync generated a complete task report for your transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.Result
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Result.
The result of the task execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.StartTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StartTime.
The time when the task execution started.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the task execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.TaskExecutionArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskExecutionArn.
The ARN of the task execution that you wanted information about. TaskExecutionArn is hierarchical and includes TaskArn for the task that was executed.
For example, a TaskExecution value with the ARN arn:aws:datasync:us-east-1:111222333444:task/task-0208075f79cedf4a2/execution/exec-08ef1e88ec491019b executed the task with the ARN arn:aws:datasync:us-east-1:111222333444:task/task-0208075f79cedf4a2.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.TaskMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskMode.
The task mode that you're using. For more information, see Choosing a task mode for your data transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskExecutionResponse.TaskReportConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskReportConfig.
The configuration of your task report, which provides detailed information about for your DataSync transfer. For more information, see Creating a task report.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.DescribeTaskResponse.Excludes
member.summary:

The exclude filters that define the files, objects, and folders in your source location that you don't want DataSync to transfer. For more information and examples, see Specifying what DataSync transfers by using filters.

member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Ec2Config
member.summary: The subnet and security groups that DataSync uses to connect to one of your Amazon EFS file system's mount targets.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Ec2Config.SecurityGroupArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityGroupArns.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the security groups associated with an Amazon EFS file system's mount target.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Ec2Config.SubnetArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SubnetArn.
Specifies the ARN of a subnet where DataSync creates the network interfaces for managing traffic during your transfer.
The subnet must be located:
In the same virtual private cloud (VPC) as the Amazon EFS file system.
In the same Availability Zone as at least one mount target for the Amazon EFS file system.
You don't need to specify a subnet that includes a file system mount target.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FilterRule
member.summary: Specifies which files, folders, and objects to include or exclude when transferring files from source to destination.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FilterRule.FilterType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FilterType.
The type of filter rule to apply. DataSync only supports the SIMPLE_PATTERN rule type.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FilterRule.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
A single filter string that consists of the patterns to include or exclude. The patterns are delimited by "|" (that is, a pipe), for example: /folder1|/folder2

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FsxProtocol
member.summary: Specifies the data transfer protocol that DataSync uses to access your Amazon FSx file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FsxProtocol.NFS
member.summary:

Specifies the Network File System (NFS) protocol configuration that DataSync uses to access your FSx for OpenZFS file system or FSx for ONTAP file system's storage virtual machine (SVM).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FsxProtocol.SMB
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SMB.
Specifies the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol configuration that DataSync uses to access your FSx for ONTAP file system's SVM.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FsxProtocolNfs
member.summary: Specifies the Network File System (NFS) protocol configuration that DataSync uses to access your FSx for OpenZFS file system or FSx for ONTAP file system's storage virtual machine (SVM).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FsxProtocolNfs.MountOptions
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MountOptions.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FsxProtocolSmb
member.summary: Specifies the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol configuration that DataSync uses to access your Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP file system's storage virtual machine (SVM). For more information, see Providing DataSync access to FSx for ONTAP file systems.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FsxProtocolSmb.Domain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Domain.
Specifies the name of the Windows domain that your storage virtual machine (SVM) belongs to.
If you have multiple domains in your environment, configuring this setting makes sure that DataSync connects to the right SVM.
If you have multiple Active Directory domains in your environment, configuring this parameter makes sure that DataSync connects to the right SVM.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FsxProtocolSmb.MountOptions

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FsxProtocolSmb.Password

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FsxProtocolSmb.User
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property User.
Specifies a user that can mount and access the files, folders, and metadata in your SVM.
For information about choosing a user with the right level of access for your transfer, see Using the SMB protocol.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.FsxUpdateProtocol
member.summary:
Specifies the data transfer protocol that DataSync uses to access your Amazon FSx file system.
You can't update the Network File System (NFS) protocol configuration for FSx for ONTAP locations. DataSync currently only supports NFS version 3 with this location type.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.GenerateRecommendationsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the GenerateRecommendations operation. Creates recommendations about where to migrate your data to in Amazon Web Services. Recommendations are generated based on information that DataSync Discovery collects about your on-premises storage system's resources. For more information, see Recommendations provided by DataSync Discovery.
Once generated, you can view your recommendations by using the DescribeStorageSystemResources operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.GenerateRecommendationsRequest.DiscoveryJobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DiscoveryJobArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the discovery job that collects information about your on-premises storage system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.GenerateRecommendationsRequest.ResourceIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceIds.
Specifies the universally unique identifiers (UUIDs) of the resources in your storage system that you want recommendations on.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.GenerateRecommendationsRequest.ResourceType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ResourceType.
Specifies the type of resource in your storage system that you want recommendations on.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.GenerateRecommendationsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GenerateRecommendations operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.HdfsNameNode
member.summary: The NameNode of the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS). The NameNode manages the file system's namespace. The NameNode performs operations such as opening, closing, and renaming files and directories. The NameNode contains the information to map blocks of data to the DataNodes.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.HdfsNameNode.Hostname
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Hostname.
The hostname of the NameNode in the HDFS cluster. This value is the IP address or Domain Name Service (DNS) name of the NameNode. An agent that's installed on-premises uses this hostname to communicate with the NameNode in the network.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.HdfsNameNode.Port
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Port.
The port that the NameNode uses to listen to client requests.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListAgentsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListAgents operation. Returns a list of DataSync agents that belong to an Amazon Web Services account in the Amazon Web Services Region specified in the request.
With pagination, you can reduce the number of agents returned in a response. If you get a truncated list of agents in a response, the response contains a marker that you can specify in your next request to fetch the next page of agents.
ListAgents is eventually consistent. This means the result of running the operation might not reflect that you just created or deleted an agent. For example, if you create an agent with CreateAgent and then immediately run ListAgents, that agent might not show up in the list right away. In situations like this, you can always confirm whether an agent has been created (or deleted) by using DescribeAgent.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListAgentsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
Specifies the maximum number of DataSync agents to list in a response. By default, a response shows a maximum of 100 agents.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListAgentsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
Specifies an opaque string that indicates the position to begin the next list of results in the response.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListAgentsResponse
member.summary: ListAgentsResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListAgentsResponse.Agents
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Agents.
A list of DataSync agents in your Amazon Web Services account in the Amazon Web Services Region specified in the request. The list is ordered by the agents' Amazon Resource Names (ARNs).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListAgentsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
The opaque string that indicates the position to begin the next list of results in the response.

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the ListDiscoveryJobs operation. Provides a list of the existing discovery jobs in the Amazon Web Services Region and Amazon Web Services account where you're using DataSync Discovery.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListDiscoveryJobsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListDiscoveryJobsRequest.NextToken
