member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListDiscoveryJobsRequest.StorageSystemArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageSystemArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an on-premises storage system. Use this parameter if you only want to list the discovery jobs that are associated with a specific storage system.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListDiscoveryJobsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the ListDiscoveryJobs operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListDiscoveryJobsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:

The opaque string that indicates the position to begin the next list of results in the response.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListLocationsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ListLocations operation. Returns a list of source and destination locations.
If you have more locations than are returned in a response (that is, the response returns only a truncated list of your agents), the response contains a token that you can specify in your next request to fetch the next page of locations.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListLocationsRequest.Filters
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Filters.
You can use API filters to narrow down the list of resources returned by ListLocations. For example, to retrieve all tasks on a specific source location, you can use ListLocations with filter name LocationType S3 and Operator Equals.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListLocationsRequest.MaxResults
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaxResults.
The maximum number of locations to return.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListLocationsRequest.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
An opaque string that indicates the position at which to begin the next list of locations.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ListLocationsResponse.NextToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NextToken.
An opaque string that indicates the position at which to begin returning the next list of locations.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.LocationFilter
member.summary:
Narrow down the list of resources returned by ListLocations. For example, to see all your Amazon S3 locations, create a filter using "Name": "LocationType", "Operator": "Equals", and "Values": "S3".
For more information, see filtering resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.LocationFilter.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the filter being used. Each API call supports a list of filters that are available for it (for example, LocationType for ListLocations).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.LocationFilter.Operator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Operator.
The operator that is used to compare filter values (for example, Equals or Contains).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.LocationFilter.Values
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Values.
The values that you want to filter for. For example, you might want to display only Amazon S3 locations.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.LocationListEntry
member.summary: Represents a single entry in a list of locations. LocationListEntry returns an array that contains a list of locations when the ListLocations operation is called.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.LocationListEntry.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the location. For Network File System (NFS) or Amazon EFS, the location is the export path. For Amazon S3, the location is the prefix path that you want to mount and use as the root of the location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.LocationListEntry.LocationUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationUri.
Represents a list of URIs of a location. LocationUri returns an array that contains a list of locations when the ListLocations operation is called.
Format: TYPE://GLOBAL_ID/SUBDIR.
TYPE designates the type of location (for example, nfs or s3).
GLOBAL_ID is the globally unique identifier of the resource that backs the location. An example for EFS is us-east-2.fs-abcd1234. An example for Amazon S3 is the bucket name, such as myBucket. An example for NFS is a valid IPv4 address or a hostname that is compliant with Domain Name Service (DNS).
SUBDIR is a valid file system path, delimited by forward slashes as is the *nix convention. For NFS and Amazon EFS, it's the export path to mount the location. For Amazon S3, it's the prefix path that you mount to and treat as the root of the location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ManifestConfig
member.summary: Configures a manifest, which is a list of files or objects that you want DataSync to transfer. For more information and configuration examples, see Specifying what DataSync transfers by using a manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ManifestConfig.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
Specifies what DataSync uses the manifest for.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ManifestConfig.Format
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Format.
Specifies the file format of your manifest. For more information, see Creating a manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ManifestConfig.Source
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Source.
Specifies the manifest that you want DataSync to use and where it's hosted.
You must specify this parameter if you're configuring a new manifest on or after February 7, 2024.
If you don't, you'll get a 400 status code and ValidationException error stating that you're missing the IAM role for DataSync to access the S3 bucket where you're hosting your manifest. For more information, see Providing DataSync access to your manifest.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.NfsMountOptions
member.summary: Specifies how DataSync can access a location using the NFS protocol.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.NfsMountOptions.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
Specifies the NFS version that you want DataSync to use when mounting your NFS share. If the server refuses to use the version specified, the task fails.
You can specify the following options:
AUTOMATIC (default): DataSync chooses NFS version 4.1.
NFS3: Stateless protocol version that allows for asynchronous writes on the server.
NFSv4_0: Stateful, firewall-friendly protocol version that supports delegations and pseudo file systems.
NFSv4_1: Stateful protocol version that supports sessions, directory delegations, and parallel data processing. NFS version 4.1 also includes all features available in version 4.0.
DataSync currently only supports NFS version 3 with Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP locations.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.OnPremConfig
member.summary: The DataSync agents that can connect to your Network File System (NFS) file server.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.OnPremConfig.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the DataSync agents that can connect to your NFS file server.
You can specify more than one agent. For more information, see Using multiple DataSync agents.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options
member.summary:
Indicates how your transfer task is configured. These options include how DataSync handles files, objects, and their associated metadata during your transfer. You also can specify how to verify data integrity, set bandwidth limits for your task, among other options.
Each option has a default value. Unless you need to, you don't have to configure any option before calling StartTaskExecution.
You also can override your task options for each task execution. For example, you might want to adjust the LogLevel for an individual execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.Atime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Atime.
Specifies whether to preserve metadata indicating the last time a file was read or written to.
The behavior of Atime isn't fully standard across platforms, so DataSync can only do this on a best-effort basis.
BEST_EFFORT (default) - DataSync attempts to preserve the original Atime attribute on all source files (that is, the version before the PREPARING steps of the task execution). This option is recommended.
NONE - Ignores Atime.
If Atime is set to BEST_EFFORT, Mtime must be set to PRESERVE.
If Atime is set to NONE, Mtime must also be NONE.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.BytesPerSecond
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BytesPerSecond.
Limits the bandwidth used by a DataSync task. For example, if you want DataSync to use a maximum of 1 MB, set this value to 1048576 (=1024*1024).
Not applicable to Enhanced mode tasks.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.Gid
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Gid.
Specifies the POSIX group ID (GID) of the file's owners.
INT_VALUE (default) - Preserves the integer value of user ID (UID) and GID, which is recommended.
NONE - Ignores UID and GID.
For more information, see Understanding how DataSync handles file and object metadata.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.LogLevel
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LogLevel.
Specifies the type of logs that DataSync publishes to a Amazon CloudWatch Logs log group. To specify the log group, see CloudWatchLogGroupArn.
BASIC - Publishes logs with only basic information (such as transfer errors).
TRANSFER - Publishes logs for all files or objects that your DataSync task transfers and performs data-integrity checks on.
OFF - No logs are published.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.Mtime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Mtime.
Specifies whether to preserve metadata indicating the last time that a file was written to before the PREPARING step of your task execution. This option is required when you need to run the a task more than once.
PRESERVE (default) - Preserves original Mtime, which is recommended.
NONE - Ignores Mtime.
If Mtime is set to PRESERVE, Atime must be set to BEST_EFFORT.
If Mtime is set to NONE, Atime must also be set to NONE.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.ObjectTags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ObjectTags.
Specifies whether you want DataSync to PRESERVE object tags (default behavior) when transferring between object storage systems. If you want your DataSync task to ignore object tags, specify the NONE value.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.OverwriteMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OverwriteMode.
Specifies whether DataSync should modify or preserve data at the destination location.
ALWAYS (default) - DataSync modifies data in the destination location when source data (including metadata) has changed.
If DataSync overwrites objects, you might incur additional charges for certain Amazon S3 storage classes (for example, for retrieval or early deletion). For more information, see Storage class considerations with Amazon S3 transfers.
NEVER - DataSync doesn't overwrite data in the destination location even if the source data has changed. You can use this option to protect against overwriting changes made to files or objects in the destination.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.PosixPermissions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PosixPermissions.
Specifies which users or groups can access a file for a specific purpose such as reading, writing, or execution of the file.
For more information, see Understanding how DataSync handles file and object metadata.
PRESERVE (default) - Preserves POSIX-style permissions, which is recommended.
NONE - Ignores POSIX-style permissions.
DataSync can preserve extant permissions of a source location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.PreserveDeletedFiles
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreserveDeletedFiles.
Specifies whether files in the destination location that don't exist in the source should be preserved. This option can affect your Amazon S3 storage cost. If your task deletes objects, you might incur minimum storage duration charges for certain storage classes. For detailed information, see Considerations when working with Amazon S3 storage classes in DataSync.
PRESERVE (default) - Ignores such destination files, which is recommended.
REMOVE - Deletes destination files that aren’t present in the source.
If you set this parameter to REMOVE, you can't set TransferMode to ALL. When you transfer all data, DataSync doesn't scan your destination location and doesn't know what to delete.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.PreserveDevices
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PreserveDevices.
Specifies whether DataSync should preserve the metadata of block and character devices in the source location and recreate the files with that device name and metadata on the destination. DataSync copies only the name and metadata of such devices.
DataSync can't copy the actual contents of these devices because they're nonterminal and don't return an end-of-file (EOF) marker.
NONE (default) - Ignores special devices (recommended).
PRESERVE - Preserves character and block device metadata. This option currently isn't supported for Amazon EFS.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.SecurityDescriptorCopyFlags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecurityDescriptorCopyFlags.
Specifies which components of the SMB security descriptor are copied from source to destination objects.
This value is only used for transfers between SMB and Amazon FSx for Windows File Server locations or between two FSx for Windows File Server locations. For more information, see Understanding how DataSync handles file and object metadata.
OWNER_DACL (default) - For each copied object, DataSync copies the following metadata:
The object owner.
NTFS discretionary access control lists (DACLs), which determine whether to grant access to an object.
DataSync won't copy NTFS system access control lists (SACLs) with this option.
OWNER_DACL_SACL - For each copied object, DataSync copies the following metadata:
The object owner.
NTFS discretionary access control lists (DACLs), which determine whether to grant access to an object.
SACLs, which are used by administrators to log attempts to access a secured object.
Copying SACLs requires granting additional permissions to the Windows user that DataSync uses to access your SMB location. For information about choosing a user with the right permissions, see required permissions for SMB, FSx for Windows File Server, or FSx for ONTAP (depending on the type of location in your transfer).
NONE - None of the SMB security descriptor components are copied. Destination objects are owned by the user that was provided for accessing the destination location. DACLs and SACLs are set based on the destination server’s configuration.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.TaskQueueing
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskQueueing.
Specifies whether your transfer tasks should be put into a queue during certain scenarios when running multiple tasks. This is ENABLED by default.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.TransferMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TransferMode.
Specifies whether DataSync transfers only the data (including metadata) that differs between locations following an initial copy or transfers all data every time you run the task. If you're planning on recurring transfers, you might only want to transfer what's changed since your previous task execution.
CHANGED (default) - After your initial full transfer, DataSync copies only the data and metadata that differs between the source and destination location.
ALL - DataSync copies everything in the source to the destination without comparing differences between the locations.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.Uid
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Uid.
Specifies the POSIX user ID (UID) of the file's owner.
INT_VALUE (default) - Preserves the integer value of UID and group ID (GID), which is recommended.
NONE - Ignores UID and GID.
For more information, see Metadata copied by DataSync.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Options.VerifyMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VerifyMode.
Specifies if and how DataSync checks the integrity of your data at the end of your transfer.
ONLY_FILES_TRANSFERRED (recommended) - DataSync calculates the checksum of transferred data (including metadata) at the source location. At the end of the transfer, DataSync then compares this checksum to the checksum calculated on that data at the destination.
This is the default option for Enhanced mode tasks.
We recommend this option when transferring to S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval or S3 Glacier Deep Archive storage classes. For more information, see Storage class considerations with Amazon S3 locations.
POINT_IN_TIME_CONSISTENT - At the end of the transfer, DataSync checks the entire source and destination to verify that both locations are fully synchronized.
The is the default option for Basic mode tasks and isn't currently supported with Enhanced mode tasks.
If you use a manifest, DataSync only scans and verifies what's listed in the manifest.
You can't use this option when transferring to S3 Glacier Flexible Retrieval or S3 Glacier Deep Archive storage classes. For more information, see Storage class considerations with Amazon S3 locations.
NONE - DataSync performs data integrity checks only during your transfer. Unlike other options, there's no additional verification at the end of your transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.PrivateLinkConfig.PrivateLinkEndpoint

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.QopConfiguration
member.summary: The Quality of Protection (QOP) configuration specifies the Remote Procedure Call (RPC) and data transfer privacy settings configured on the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.QopConfiguration.DataTransferProtection
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataTransferProtection.
The data transfer protection setting configured on the HDFS cluster. This setting corresponds to your dfs.data.transfer.protection setting in the hdfs-site.xml file on your Hadoop cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.QopConfiguration.RpcProtection
member.summary:

The RPC protection setting configured on the HDFS cluster. This setting corresponds to your hadoop.rpc.protection setting in your core-site.xml file on your Hadoop cluster.

For more information, see Recommendations provided by DataSync Discovery.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Recommendation.EstimatedMonthlyStorageCost

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Recommendation.StorageType

A recommended Amazon Web Services storage service that you can migrate data to based on information that DataSync Discovery collects about your on-premises storage system.

Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM policy that allows DataSync to upload a task report to your S3 bucket. For more information, see Allowing DataSync to upload a task report to an Amazon S3 bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportDestinationS3.S3BucketArn
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportDestinationS3.Subdirectory

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportOverride
member.summary: Specifies the level of detail for a particular aspect of your DataSync task report.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportOverride.ReportLevel
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportLevel.
Specifies whether your task report includes errors only or successes and errors.
For example, your report might mostly include only what didn't go well in your transfer (ERRORS_ONLY). At the same time, you want to verify that your task filter is working correctly. In this situation, you can get a list of what files DataSync successfully skipped and if something transferred that you didn't to transfer (SUCCESSES_AND_ERRORS).

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportOverrides
member.summary: The level of detail included in each aspect of your DataSync task report.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportOverrides.Deleted
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Deleted.
Specifies the level of reporting for the files, objects, and directories that DataSync attempted to delete in your destination location. This only applies if you configure your task to delete data in the destination that isn't in the source.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportOverrides.Skipped
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Skipped.
Specifies the level of reporting for the files, objects, and directories that DataSync attempted to skip during your transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportOverrides.Transferred
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Transferred.
Specifies the level of reporting for the files, objects, and directories that DataSync attempted to transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportOverrides.Verified
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Verified.
Specifies the level of reporting for the files, objects, and directories that DataSync attempted to verify at the end of your transfer.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportResult
member.summary: Indicates whether DataSync created a complete task report for your transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportResult.ErrorCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorCode.
Indicates the code associated with the error if DataSync can't create a complete report.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportResult.ErrorDetail
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorDetail.
Provides details about issues creating a report.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.ReportResult.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Indicates whether DataSync is still working on your report, created a report, or can't create a complete report.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.S3Config

Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that DataSync uses to access your S3 bucket.
For more information, see Providing DataSync access to S3 buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.S3Config.BucketAccessRoleArn
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.S3ManifestConfig
member.summary: Specifies the S3 bucket where you're hosting the manifest that you want DataSync to use. For more information and configuration examples, see Specifying what DataSync transfers by using a manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.S3ManifestConfig.BucketAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketAccessRoleArn.
Specifies the Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows DataSync to access your manifest. For more information, see Providing DataSync access to your manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.S3ManifestConfig.ManifestObjectPath
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManifestObjectPath.
Specifies the Amazon S3 object key of your manifest. This can include a prefix (for example, prefix/my-manifest.csv).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.S3ManifestConfig.ManifestObjectVersionId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManifestObjectVersionId.
Specifies the object version ID of the manifest that you want DataSync to use. If you don't set this, DataSync uses the latest version of the object.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.S3ManifestConfig.S3BucketArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3BucketArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the S3 bucket where you're hosting your manifest.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.SmbMountOptions
member.summary: Specifies the version of the Server Message Block (SMB) protocol that DataSync uses to access an SMB file server.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.SmbMountOptions.Version
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Version.
By default, DataSync automatically chooses an SMB protocol version based on negotiation with your SMB file server. You also can configure DataSync to use a specific SMB version, but we recommend doing this only if DataSync has trouble negotiating with the SMB file server automatically.
These are the following options for configuring the SMB version:
AUTOMATIC (default): DataSync and the SMB file server negotiate the highest version of SMB that they mutually support between 2.1 and 3.1.1.
This is the recommended option. If you instead choose a specific version that your file server doesn't support, you may get an Operation Not Supported error.
SMB3: Restricts the protocol negotiation to only SMB version 3.0.2.
SMB2: Restricts the protocol negotiation to only SMB version 2.1.
SMB2_0: Restricts the protocol negotiation to only SMB version 2.0.
SMB1: Restricts the protocol negotiation to only SMB version 1.0.
The SMB1 option isn't available when creating an Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.SourceManifestConfig
member.summary: Specifies the manifest that you want DataSync to use and where it's hosted. For more information and configuration examples, see Specifying what DataSync transfers by using a manifest.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.SourceManifestConfig.S3
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3.
Specifies the S3 bucket where you're hosting your manifest.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartDiscoveryJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the StartDiscoveryJob operation. Runs a DataSync discovery job on your on-premises storage system. If you haven't added the storage system to DataSync Discovery yet, do this first by using the AddStorageSystem operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartDiscoveryJobRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
Specifies a client token to make sure requests with this API operation are idempotent. If you don't specify a client token, DataSync generates one for you automatically.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartDiscoveryJobRequest.CollectionDurationMinutes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CollectionDurationMinutes.
Specifies in minutes how long you want the discovery job to run.
For more accurate recommendations, we recommend a duration of at least 14 days. Longer durations allow time to collect a sufficient number of data points and provide a realistic representation of storage performance and utilization.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartDiscoveryJobRequest.StorageSystemArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageSystemArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the on-premises storage system that you want to run the discovery job on.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartDiscoveryJobRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies labels that help you categorize, filter, and search for your Amazon Web Services resources.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartDiscoveryJobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StartDiscoveryJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartDiscoveryJobResponse.DiscoveryJobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DiscoveryJobArn.
The ARN of the discovery job that you started.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartTaskExecutionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StartTaskExecution operation. Starts an DataSync transfer task. For each task, you can only run one task execution at a time.
There are several steps to a task execution. For more information, see Task execution statuses.
If you're planning to transfer data to or from an Amazon S3 location, review how DataSync can affect your S3 request charges and the DataSync pricing page before you begin.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartTaskExecutionRequest.Excludes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Excludes.
Specifies a list of filter rules that determines which files to exclude from a task. The list contains a single filter string that consists of the patterns to exclude. The patterns are delimited by "|" (that is, a pipe), for example, "/folder1|/folder2".

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartTaskExecutionRequest.Includes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Includes.
Specifies a list of filter rules that determines which files to include when running a task. The pattern should contain a single filter string that consists of the patterns to include. The patterns are delimited by "|" (that is, a pipe), for example, "/folder1|/folder2".

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartTaskExecutionRequest.ManifestConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManifestConfig.
Configures a manifest, which is a list of files or objects that you want DataSync to transfer. For more information and configuration examples, see Specifying what DataSync transfers by using a manifest.
When using this parameter, your caller identity (the role that you're using DataSync with) must have the iam:PassRole permission. The AWSDataSyncFullAccess policy includes this permission.
To remove a manifest configuration, specify this parameter with an empty value.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartTaskExecutionRequest.OverrideOptions
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OverrideOptions.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartTaskExecutionRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
Specifies the tags that you want to apply to the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) representing the task execution.
Tags are key-value pairs that help you manage, filter, and search for your DataSync resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartTaskExecutionRequest.TaskArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task that you want to start.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartTaskExecutionRequest.TaskReportConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskReportConfig.
Specifies how you want to configure a task report, which provides detailed information about your DataSync transfer. For more information, see Monitoring your DataSync transfers with task reports.
When using this parameter, your caller identity (the role that you're using DataSync with) must have the iam:PassRole permission. The AWSDataSyncFullAccess policy includes this permission.
To remove a task report configuration, specify this parameter as empty.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartTaskExecutionResponse
member.summary: StartTaskExecutionResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StartTaskExecutionResponse.TaskExecutionArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskExecutionArn.
The ARN of the running task execution.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StopDiscoveryJobRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StopDiscoveryJob operation. Stops a running DataSync discovery job.
You can stop a discovery job anytime. A job that's stopped before it's scheduled to end likely will provide you some information about your on-premises storage system resources. To get recommendations for a stopped job, you must use the GenerateRecommendations operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StopDiscoveryJobRequest.DiscoveryJobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DiscoveryJobArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the discovery job that you want to stop.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StopDiscoveryJobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StopDiscoveryJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.StorageSystemListEntry.StorageSystemArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageSystemArn.
The Amazon Resource Names (ARN) of an on-premises storage system that you added to DataSync Discovery.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TagListEntry.Value

Container for the parameters to the TagResource operation. Applies a tag to an Amazon Web Services resource. Tags are key-value pairs that can help you manage, filter, and search for your resources.
These include DataSync resources, such as locations, tasks, and task executions.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TagResourceRequest.ResourceArn

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TagResourceRequest.Tags

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TagResourceResponse

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionFilesFailedDetail
member.summary:
The number of objects that DataSync fails to prepare, transfer, verify, and delete during your task execution.
Applies only to Enhanced mode tasks.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionFilesFailedDetail.Delete
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Delete.
The number of objects that DataSync fails to delete during your task execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionFilesFailedDetail.Prepare
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Prepare.
The number of objects that DataSync fails to prepare during your task execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionFilesFailedDetail.Transfer
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionFilesFailedDetail.Verify
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Verify.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionFilesListedDetail
member.summary:
The number of objects that DataSync finds at your locations.
Applies only to Enhanced mode tasks.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionFilesListedDetail.AtDestinationForDelete
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AtDestinationForDelete.
The number of objects that DataSync finds at your destination location. This counter is only applicable if you configure your task to delete data in the destination that isn't in the source.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionFilesListedDetail.AtSource
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AtSource.
The number of objects that DataSync finds at your source location.
With a manifest, DataSync lists only what's in your manifest (and not everything at your source location).
With an include filter, DataSync lists only what matches the filter at your source location.
With an exclude filter, DataSync lists everything at your source location before applying the filter.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionListEntry
member.summary: Represents a single entry in a list of DataSync task executions that's returned with the ListTaskExecutions operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionListEntry.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of a task execution. For more information, see Task execution statuses.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionListEntry.TaskExecutionArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskExecutionArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a task execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionListEntry.TaskMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskMode.
The task mode that you're using. For more information, see Choosing a task mode for your data transfer.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionResultDetail
member.summary: Provides detailed information about the result of your DataSync task execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionResultDetail.ErrorCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorCode.
An error that DataSync encountered during your task execution. You can use this information to help troubleshoot issues.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionResultDetail.ErrorDetail
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorDetail.
The detailed description of an error that DataSync encountered during your task execution. You can use this information to help troubleshoot issues.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionResultDetail.PrepareDuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PrepareDuration.
The time in milliseconds that your task execution was in the PREPARING step. For more information, see Task execution statuses.
For Enhanced mode tasks, the value is always 0. For more information, see How DataSync prepares your data transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionResultDetail.PrepareStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PrepareStatus.
The status of the PREPARING step for your task execution. For more information, see Task execution statuses.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionResultDetail.TotalDuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TotalDuration.
The time in milliseconds that your task execution ran.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionResultDetail.TransferDuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TransferDuration.
The time in milliseconds that your task execution was in the TRANSFERRING step. For more information, see Task execution statuses.
For Enhanced mode tasks, the value is always 0. For more information, see How DataSync transfers your data.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionResultDetail.TransferStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TransferStatus.
The status of the TRANSFERRING step for your task execution. For more information, see Task execution statuses.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionResultDetail.VerifyDuration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VerifyDuration.
The time in milliseconds that your task execution was in the VERIFYING step. For more information, see Task execution statuses.
For Enhanced mode tasks, the value is always 0. For more information, see How DataSync verifies your data's integrity.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskExecutionResultDetail.VerifyStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property VerifyStatus.
The status of the VERIFYING step for your task execution. For more information, see Task execution statuses.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskFilter
member.summary:
You can use API filters to narrow down the list of resources returned by ListTasks. For example, to retrieve all tasks on a source location, you can use ListTasks with filter name LocationId and Operator Equals with the ARN for the location.
For more information, see filtering DataSync resources.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskFilter.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the filter being used. Each API call supports a list of filters that are available for it. For example, LocationId for ListTasks.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskFilter.Operator
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Operator.
The operator that is used to compare filter values (for example, Equals or Contains).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskFilter.Values
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Values.
The values that you want to filter for. For example, you might want to display only tasks for a specific destination location.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskListEntry
member.summary: Represents a single entry in a list of tasks. TaskListEntry returns an array that contains a list of tasks when the ListTasks operation is called. A task includes the source and destination file systems to sync and the options to use for the tasks.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskListEntry.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the task.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskListEntry.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the task.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskListEntry.TaskArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskListEntry.TaskMode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskMode.
The task mode that you're using. For more information, see Choosing a task mode for your data transfer.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskReportConfig
member.summary:
Specifies how you want to configure a task report, which provides detailed information about for your DataSync transfer.
For more information, see Task reports.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskReportConfig.Destination
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Destination.
Specifies the Amazon S3 bucket where DataSync uploads your task report. For more information, see Task reports.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskReportConfig.ObjectVersionIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ObjectVersionIds.
Specifies whether your task report includes the new version of each object transferred into an S3 bucket. This only applies if you enable versioning on your bucket. Keep in mind that setting this to INCLUDE can increase the duration of your task execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskReportConfig.OutputType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputType.
Specifies the type of task report that you want:
SUMMARY_ONLY: Provides necessary details about your task, including the number of files, objects, and directories transferred and transfer duration.
STANDARD: Provides complete details about your task, including a full list of files, objects, and directories that were transferred, skipped, verified, and more.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskReportConfig.Overrides
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Overrides.
Customizes the reporting level for aspects of your task report. For example, your report might generally only include errors, but you could specify that you want a list of successes and errors just for the files that DataSync attempted to delete in your destination location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskReportConfig.ReportLevel
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReportLevel.
Specifies whether you want your task report to include only what went wrong with your transfer or a list of what succeeded and didn't.
ERRORS_ONLY: A report shows what DataSync was unable to transfer, skip, verify, and delete.
SUCCESSES_AND_ERRORS: A report shows what DataSync was able and unable to transfer, skip, verify, and delete.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskSchedule
member.summary: Configures your DataSync task to run on a schedule (at a minimum interval of 1 hour).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskSchedule.ScheduleExpression
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScheduleExpression.
Specifies your task schedule by using a cron or rate expression.
Use cron expressions for task schedules that run on a specific time and day. For example, the following cron expression creates a task schedule that runs at 8 AM on the first Wednesday of every month:
cron(0 8 * * 3#1)
Use rate expressions for task schedules that run on a regular interval. For example, the following rate expression creates a task schedule that runs every 12 hours:
rate(12 hours)
For information about cron and rate expression syntax, see the Amazon EventBridge User Guide .

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskSchedule.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
Specifies whether to enable or disable your task schedule. Your schedule is enabled by default, but there can be situations where you need to disable it. For example, you might need to pause a recurring transfer to fix an issue with your task or perform maintenance on your storage system.
DataSync might disable your schedule automatically if your task fails repeatedly with the same error. For more information, see TaskScheduleDetails.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskScheduleDetails
member.summary: Provides information about your DataSync task schedule.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskScheduleDetails.DisabledBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DisabledBy.
Indicates how your task schedule was disabled.
USER - Your schedule was manually disabled by using the UpdateTask operation or DataSync console.
SERVICE - Your schedule was automatically disabled by DataSync because the task failed repeatedly with the same error.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskScheduleDetails.DisabledReason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DisabledReason.
Provides a reason if the task schedule is disabled.
If your schedule is disabled by USER, you see a Manually disabled by user. message.
If your schedule is disabled by SERVICE, you see an error message to help you understand why the task keeps failing. For information on resolving DataSync errors, see Troubleshooting issues with DataSync transfers.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.TaskScheduleDetails.StatusUpdateTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StatusUpdateTime.
Indicates the last time the status of your task schedule changed. For example, if DataSync automatically disables your schedule because of a repeated error, you can see when the schedule was disabled.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Throughput
member.summary: The throughput peaks for an on-premises storage system volume. Each data point represents the 95th percentile peak value during a 1-hour interval.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Throughput.Other
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Other.
Peak throughput unrelated to read and write operations.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Throughput.Read
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Read.
Peak throughput related to read operations.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Throughput.Total
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Total.
Peak total throughput on your on-premises storage system resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.Throughput.Write
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Write.
Peak throughput related to write operations.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UntagResourceRequest

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UntagResourceRequest.Keys

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UntagResourceRequest.ResourceArn

member.summary:

Specifies in minutes how long that you want the discovery job to run. (You can't set this parameter to less than the number of minutes that the job has already run for.)

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationAzureBlobRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLocationAzureBlob operation. Modifies the following configurations of the Microsoft Azure Blob Storage transfer location that you're using with DataSync.
For more information, see Configuring DataSync transfers with Azure Blob Storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationAzureBlobRequest.AccessTier
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessTier.
Specifies the access tier that you want your objects or files transferred into. This only applies when using the location as a transfer destination. For more information, see Access tiers.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationAzureBlobRequest.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DataSync agent that can connect with your Azure Blob Storage container.
You can specify more than one agent. For more information, see Using multiple agents for your transfer.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationAzureBlobRequest.AuthenticationType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthenticationType.
Specifies the authentication method DataSync uses to access your Azure Blob Storage. DataSync can access blob storage using a shared access signature (SAS).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationAzureBlobRequest.BlobType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlobType.
Specifies the type of blob that you want your objects or files to be when transferring them into Azure Blob Storage. Currently, DataSync only supports moving data into Azure Blob Storage as block blobs. For more information on blob types, see the Azure Blob Storage documentation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationAzureBlobRequest.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the ARN of the Azure Blob Storage transfer location that you're updating.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationAzureBlobRequest.SasConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SasConfiguration.
Specifies the SAS configuration that allows DataSync to access your Azure Blob Storage.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationAzureBlobRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies path segments if you want to limit your transfer to a virtual directory in your container (for example, /my/images).

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationAzureBlobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLocationAzureBlob operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationEfsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLocationEfs operation. Modifies the following configuration parameters of the Amazon EFS transfer location that you're using with DataSync.
For more information, see Configuring DataSync transfers with Amazon EFS.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationEfsRequest.AccessPointArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessPointArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the access point that DataSync uses to mount your Amazon EFS file system.
For more information, see Accessing restricted Amazon EFS file systems.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationEfsRequest.FileSystemAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FileSystemAccessRoleArn.
Specifies an Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows DataSync to access your Amazon EFS file system.
For information on creating this role, see Creating a DataSync IAM role for Amazon EFS file system access.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationEfsRequest.InTransitEncryption
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InTransitEncryption.
Specifies whether you want DataSync to use Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.2 encryption when it transfers data to or from your Amazon EFS file system.
If you specify an access point using AccessPointArn or an IAM role using FileSystemAccessRoleArn, you must set this parameter to TLS1_2.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationEfsRequest.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EFS transfer location that you're updating.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationEfsRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies a mount path for your Amazon EFS file system. This is where DataSync reads or writes data on your file system (depending on if this is a source or destination location).
By default, DataSync uses the root directory (or access point if you provide one by using AccessPointArn). You can also include subdirectories using forward slashes (for example, /path/to/folder).

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationEfsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLocationEfs operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxLustreRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLocationFsxLustre operation. Modifies the following configuration parameters of the Amazon FSx for Lustre transfer location that you're using with DataSync.
For more information, see Configuring DataSync transfers with FSx for Lustre.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxLustreRequest.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the FSx for Lustre transfer location that you're updating.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxLustreRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies a mount path for your FSx for Lustre file system. The path can include subdirectories.
When the location is used as a source, DataSync reads data from the mount path. When the location is used as a destination, DataSync writes data to the mount path. If you don't include this parameter, DataSync uses the file system's root directory (/).

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxLustreResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLocationFsxLustre operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxOntapRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLocationFsxOntap operation. Modifies the following configuration parameters of the Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP transfer location that you're using with DataSync.
For more information, see Configuring DataSync transfers with FSx for ONTAP.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxOntapRequest.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the FSx for ONTAP transfer location that you're updating.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxOntapRequest.Protocol
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Protocol.
Specifies the data transfer protocol that DataSync uses to access your Amazon FSx file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxOntapRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies a path to the file share in the storage virtual machine (SVM) where you want to transfer data to or from.
You can specify a junction path (also known as a mount point), qtree path (for NFS file shares), or share name (for SMB file shares). For example, your mount path might be /vol1, /vol1/tree1, or /share1.
Don't specify a junction path in the SVM's root volume. For more information, see Managing FSx for ONTAP storage virtual machines in the Amazon FSx for NetApp ONTAP User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxOntapResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLocationFsxOntap operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxOpenZfsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLocationFsxOpenZfs operation. Modifies the following configuration parameters of the Amazon FSx for OpenZFS transfer location that you're using with DataSync.
For more information, see Configuring DataSync transfers with FSx for OpenZFS.
Request parameters related to SMB aren't supported with the UpdateLocationFsxOpenZfs operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxOpenZfsRequest.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the FSx for OpenZFS transfer location that you're updating.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxOpenZfsRequest.Protocol
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Protocol.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxOpenZfsRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies a subdirectory in the location's path that must begin with /fsx. DataSync uses this subdirectory to read or write data (depending on whether the file system is a source or destination location).

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxOpenZfsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLocationFsxOpenZfs operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxWindowsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLocationFsxWindows operation. Modifies the following configuration parameters of the Amazon FSx for Windows File Server transfer location that you're using with DataSync.
For more information, see Configuring DataSync transfers with FSx for Windows File Server.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxWindowsRequest.Domain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Domain.
Specifies the name of the Windows domain that your FSx for Windows File Server file system belongs to.
If you have multiple Active Directory domains in your environment, configuring this parameter makes sure that DataSync connects to the right file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxWindowsRequest.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the ARN of the FSx for Windows File Server transfer location that you're updating.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxWindowsRequest.Password
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Password.
Specifies the password of the user with the permissions to mount and access the files, folders, and file metadata in your FSx for Windows File Server file system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxWindowsRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies a mount path for your file system using forward slashes. DataSync uses this subdirectory to read or write data (depending on whether the file system is a source or destination location).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxWindowsRequest.User
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property User.
Specifies the user with the permissions to mount and access the files, folders, and file metadata in your FSx for Windows File Server file system.
For information about choosing a user with the right level of access for your transfer, see required permissions for FSx for Windows File Server locations.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationFsxWindowsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLocationFsxWindows operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLocationHdfs operation. Modifies the following configuration parameters of the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) transfer location that you're using with DataSync.
For more information, see Configuring DataSync transfers with an HDFS cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
The Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the DataSync agents that can connect to your HDFS cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.AuthenticationType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AuthenticationType.
The type of authentication used to determine the identity of the user.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.BlockSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockSize.
The size of the data blocks to write into the HDFS cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.KerberosKeytab
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KerberosKeytab.
The Kerberos key table (keytab) that contains mappings between the defined Kerberos principal and the encrypted keys. You can load the keytab from a file by providing the file's address. If you use the CLI, it performs base64 encoding for you. Otherwise, provide the base64-encoded text.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.KerberosKrb5Conf
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KerberosKrb5Conf.
The krb5.conf file that contains the Kerberos configuration information. You can load the krb5.conf file by providing the file's address. If you're using the CLI, it performs the base64 encoding for you. Otherwise, provide the base64-encoded text.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.KerberosPrincipal
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KerberosPrincipal.
The Kerberos principal with access to the files and folders on the HDFS cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.KmsKeyProviderUri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyProviderUri.
The URI of the HDFS cluster's Key Management Server (KMS).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source HDFS cluster location.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.NameNodes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NameNodes.
The NameNode that manages the HDFS namespace. The NameNode performs operations such as opening, closing, and renaming files and directories. The NameNode contains the information to map blocks of data to the DataNodes. You can use only one NameNode.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.QopConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property QopConfiguration.
The Quality of Protection (QOP) configuration specifies the Remote Procedure Call (RPC) and data transfer privacy settings configured on the Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.ReplicationFactor
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationFactor.
The number of DataNodes to replicate the data to when writing to the HDFS cluster.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.SimpleUser
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SimpleUser.
The user name used to identify the client on the host operating system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
A subdirectory in the HDFS cluster. This subdirectory is used to read data from or write data to the HDFS cluster.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationHdfsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLocationHdfs operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationNfsRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLocationNfs operation. Modifies the following configuration parameters of the Network File System (NFS) transfer location that you're using with DataSync.
For more information, see Configuring transfers with an NFS file server.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationNfsRequest.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the NFS transfer location that you want to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationNfsRequest.MountOptions
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MountOptions.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationNfsRequest.OnPremConfig
member.summary: Gets and sets the property OnPremConfig.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationNfsRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies the export path in your NFS file server that you want DataSync to mount.
This path (or a subdirectory of the path) is where DataSync transfers data to or from. For information on configuring an export for DataSync, see Accessing NFS file servers.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationNfsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLocationNfs operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationObjectStorageRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLocationObjectStorage operation. Modifies the following configuration parameters of the object storage transfer location that you're using with DataSync.
For more information, see Configuring DataSync transfers with an object storage system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationObjectStorageRequest.AccessKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessKey.
Specifies the access key (for example, a user name) if credentials are required to authenticate with the object storage server.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationObjectStorageRequest.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Names (ARNs) of the DataSync agents that can connect with your object storage system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationObjectStorageRequest.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the ARN of the object storage system location that you're updating.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationObjectStorageRequest.SecretKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SecretKey.
Specifies the secret key (for example, a password) if credentials are required to authenticate with the object storage server.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationObjectStorageRequest.ServerCertificate
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerCertificate.
Specifies a certificate chain for DataSync to authenticate with your object storage system if the system uses a private or self-signed certificate authority (CA). You must specify a single .pem file with a full certificate chain (for example, file:///home/user/.ssh/object_storage_certificates.pem).
The certificate chain might include:
The object storage system's certificate
All intermediate certificates (if there are any)
The root certificate of the signing CA
You can concatenate your certificates into a .pem file (which can be up to 32768 bytes before base64 encoding). The following example cat command creates an object_storage_certificates.pem file that includes three certificates:
cat object_server_certificate.pem intermediate_certificate.pem ca_root_certificate.pem > object_storage_certificates.pem
To use this parameter, configure ServerProtocol to HTTPS.
Updating this parameter doesn't interfere with tasks that you have in progress.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationObjectStorageRequest.ServerPort
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerPort.
Specifies the port that your object storage server accepts inbound network traffic on (for example, port 443).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationObjectStorageRequest.ServerProtocol
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerProtocol.
Specifies the protocol that your object storage server uses to communicate.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationObjectStorageRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies the object prefix for your object storage server. If this is a source location, DataSync only copies objects with this prefix. If this is a destination location, DataSync writes all objects with this prefix.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationObjectStorageResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLocationObjectStorage operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationS3Request
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLocationS3 operation. Modifies the following configuration parameters of the Amazon S3 transfer location that you're using with DataSync.
Before you begin, make sure that you read the following topics:
Storage class considerations with Amazon S3 locations
Evaluating S3 request costs when using DataSync

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationS3Request.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon S3 transfer location that you're updating.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationS3Request.S3Config
member.summary: Gets and sets the property S3Config.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationS3Request.S3StorageClass
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3StorageClass.
Specifies the storage class that you want your objects to use when Amazon S3 is a transfer destination.
For buckets in Amazon Web Services Regions, the storage class defaults to STANDARD. For buckets on Outposts, the storage class defaults to OUTPOSTS.
For more information, see Storage class considerations with Amazon S3 transfers.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationS3Request.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies a prefix in the S3 bucket that DataSync reads from or writes to (depending on whether the bucket is a source or destination location).
DataSync can't transfer objects with a prefix that begins with a slash (/) or includes //, /./, or /../ patterns. For example:
/photos
photos//2006/January
photos/./2006/February
photos/../2006/March

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationS3Response
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLocationS3 operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationSmbRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateLocationSmb operation. Modifies the following configuration parameters of the Server Message Block (SMB) transfer location that you're using with DataSync.
For more information, see Configuring DataSync transfers with an SMB file server.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationSmbRequest.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
Specifies the DataSync agent (or agents) that can connect to your SMB file server. You specify an agent by using its Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationSmbRequest.Domain
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Domain.
Specifies the Windows domain name that your SMB file server belongs to.
If you have multiple domains in your environment, configuring this parameter makes sure that DataSync connects to the right file server.
For more information, see required permissions for SMB locations.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationSmbRequest.LocationArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LocationArn.
Specifies the ARN of the SMB location that you want to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationSmbRequest.MountOptions
member.summary: Gets and sets the property MountOptions.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationSmbRequest.Password
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Password.
Specifies the password of the user who can mount your SMB file server and has permission to access the files and folders involved in your transfer.
For more information, see required permissions for SMB locations.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationSmbRequest.Subdirectory
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Subdirectory.
Specifies the name of the share exported by your SMB file server where DataSync will read or write data. You can include a subdirectory in the share path (for example, /path/to/subdirectory). Make sure that other SMB clients in your network can also mount this path.
To copy all data in the specified subdirectory, DataSync must be able to mount the SMB share and access all of its data. For more information, see required permissions for SMB locations.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationSmbRequest.User
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property User.
Specifies the user name that can mount your SMB file server and has permission to access the files and folders involved in your transfer.
For information about choosing a user with the right level of access for your transfer, see required permissions for SMB locations.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateLocationSmbResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateLocationSmb operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateStorageSystemRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateStorageSystem operation. Modifies some configurations of an on-premises storage system resource that you're using with DataSync Discovery.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateStorageSystemRequest.AgentArns
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AgentArns.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the DataSync agent that connects to and reads your on-premises storage system. You can only specify one ARN.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateStorageSystemRequest.CloudWatchLogGroupArn
member.summary:

Specifies the ARN of the Amazon CloudWatch log group for monitoring and logging discovery job events.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateStorageSystemRequest.Credentials
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Credentials.
Specifies the user name and password for accessing your on-premises storage system's management interface.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateStorageSystemRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Specifies a familiar name for your on-premises storage system.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateStorageSystemRequest.ServerConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerConfiguration.
Specifies the server name and network port required to connect with your on-premises storage system's management interface.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateStorageSystemRequest.StorageSystemArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property StorageSystemArn.
Specifies the ARN of the on-premises storage system that you want reconfigure.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateStorageSystemResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateStorageSystem operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskExecutionRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the UpdateTaskExecution operation. Updates the configuration of a running DataSync task execution.
Currently, the only Option that you can modify with UpdateTaskExecution is BytesPerSecond , which throttles bandwidth for a running or queued task execution.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskExecutionRequest.Options
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Options.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskExecutionRequest.TaskExecutionArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskExecutionArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the task execution that you're updating.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskExecutionResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateTaskExecution operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the UpdateTask operation. Updates the configuration of a task, which defines where and how DataSync transfers your data.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskRequest.CloudWatchLogGroupArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CloudWatchLogGroupArn.
Specifies the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon CloudWatch log group for monitoring your task.
For Enhanced mode tasks, you must use /aws/datasync as your log group name. For example:
arn:aws:logs:us-east-1:111222333444:log-group:/aws/datasync:*
For more information, see Monitoring data transfers with CloudWatch Logs.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskRequest.Excludes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Excludes.
Specifies exclude filters that define the files, objects, and folders in your source location that you don't want DataSync to transfer. For more information and examples, see Specifying what DataSync transfers by using filters.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskRequest.Includes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Includes.
Specifies include filters define the files, objects, and folders in your source location that you want DataSync to transfer. For more information and examples, see Specifying what DataSync transfers by using filters.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskRequest.ManifestConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManifestConfig.
Configures a manifest, which is a list of files or objects that you want DataSync to transfer. For more information and configuration examples, see Specifying what DataSync transfers by using a manifest.
When using this parameter, your caller identity (the IAM role that you're using DataSync with) must have the iam:PassRole permission. The AWSDataSyncFullAccess policy includes this permission.
To remove a manifest configuration, specify this parameter as empty.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
Specifies the name of your task.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskRequest.Options
member.summary: Gets and sets the property Options.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskRequest.Schedule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Schedule.
Specifies a schedule for when you want your task to run. For more information, see Scheduling your task.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskRequest.TaskArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskArn.
Specifies the ARN of the task that you want to update.

member.name: P:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskRequest.TaskReportConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TaskReportConfig.
Specifies how you want to configure a task report, which provides detailed information about your DataSync transfer. For more information, see Monitoring your DataSync transfers with task reports.
When using this parameter, your caller identity (the IAM role that you're using DataSync with) must have the iam:PassRole permission. The AWSDataSyncFullAccess policy includes this permission.
To remove a task report configuration, specify this parameter as empty.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.Model.UpdateTaskResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the UpdateTask operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.DataSync.AmazonDataSyncClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing DataSync
DataSync
DataSync is an online data movement and discovery service that simplifies data migration and helps you quickly, easily, and securely transfer your file or object data to, from, and between Amazon Web Services storage services.
This API interface reference includes documentation for using DataSync programmatically. For complete information, see the DataSync User Guide .

member.name: M:Amazon.DataSync.AmazonDataSyncClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonDataSyncClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.summary: Creates an Amazon Web Services resource for an on-premises storage system that you want DataSync Discovery to collect information about.

A cancellation token that can be used by other objects or threads to receive notice of cancellation.
member.returns: The response from the AddStorageSystem service method, as returned by DataSync.
